intro: Cracca dichrocarpa, commonly known as the two-colored cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Cracca dichrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
